PARAGRAPH.STRING: (October 15 1880 - October 2 1958) was a Scottish author, campaigner for women's rights and pioneer in the field of family planning.
edited the journal Birth Control News which gave anatomically explicit advice, and in addition to
enthusiasm for protests at places of worship this provoked protest from both the Church of England and the Catholic Church.
sex manual Married Love, which was written while
was still a virgin, was controversial and influential.
was voted 'Woman of the Millennium' by Guardian newspaper readers in the UK.

name, Marie Stopes International Global Partnership, works in 38 countries across the world and currently in the UK is the largest provider of family planning services outside the National Health Service.
